ai.summary: A scenic 13.3 km coastal hike along the John O'Groats Trail from Lybster to Whaligoe in the UK. The route follows exposed cliff paths and quieter shoreline sections, delivering dramatic sea views and a steady moderate pace for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mix of grassy cliff-top paths, rocky shore sections, and farm tracks. Expect uneven footing, short ascents and descents, gates or stiles, and occasional mud after rain. The coastal wind can be strong and the terrain can feel exposed in places.
ai.safety_notes: Weather on the Scottish coast can change rapidly; check a reliable forecast before starting. The route runs along exposed cliffs, so stay away from edges and mind the wind. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring waterproof clothing. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and navigation tools; mobile reception may be limited in remote sections. Bring enough water and snacks, plus a warm layer. Inform someone of your plans and expected return. If conditions worsen, turn back and seek shelter; there are limited services along the trail.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Layers for warmth and wind protection
Fully charged phone and portable power bank
Lightweight emergency shelter or space blanket
Basic first aid kit and a whistle
ai.best_seasons: May to September are ideal for this coastal hike in the UK, offering longer daylight and milder conditions. Spring and autumn can also be pleasant but be prepared for wind and rain; winter is challenging with shorter days and harsher weather.

seo.title: John O'Groats Trail: Lybster to Whaligoe – 13.3 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a 13.3 km coastal section of the John O'Groats Trail from Lybster to Whaligoe. Moderate difficulty, safety tips, gear checklist, and best seasons for UK hikers.
